Share I ll never see him again : Grieving mother appeals for help to find son s killer - Yahoo7 A grieving mother, whose son had his throat slashed in an attack at a Melbourne shopping centre, is appealing for help to find the killer. Close Grieving mother appeals for help to find son’s killer UP NEXT VIDEO Grieving mother appeals for help to find son’s killer Grieving mother appeals for help to find son’s killer David Dick’s mother Carol Cloke broke down on Tuesday as she pleaded for anyone with information to come forward. “David was the most beautiful, fun, loving, magical person,” Ms Cloke said. Murder victim David Dick. Source: 7 News The man police say murdered Mr Dick. Source: 7 News “We all loved him so much, he had an enormous strength of character. “I’ll never see him again.” Mr Dick was attacked by a man with a sword without warning at Westfield Doncaster last Friday, and didn’t have a chance to defend himself. A devastated Carol Cloke. Source: 7 News The 36-year-old had been on his way to work, with Victorian Police confident the killer stalked Mr Dick in the lead up to the brutal murder. “He’s watching David come into the elevator and come up in the elevator,” Inspector Michael Hughes said. “He positions himself to attack him and he hits him pretty hard the second he comes out.” The killer is seen at the murder scene just 24 hours prior. Source: 7 News Police have released chilling images of the killer taken the day before Mr Dick’s attack, hopeful somebody may be able to identify him. “The person loitering on the Thursday is the person who attacked David,” Insp Hughes said. Murdered man attacked without warning Police at the Westfield Doncaster murder scene. Source: 7 News In the vision, the man is seen entering and exiting a carpark elevator carrying a long sword-like object in a yellow bag. Police say that was the same weapon used to kill Mr Dick the following day in a targeted attack. “Nobody deserves to be treated like that,” Mr Dick’s uncle said. Can you identify this man? “If they know who that person is, would they please come forward and speak to the police,” he pleaded. The man is described as Caucasian, aged in his 30s, around 176cm tall with mousey brown hair. It’s believed the man injured himself in the attack, with those injuries possibly visible. Anyone with information on the attack should call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. Share I ll never see him again : Grieving mother appeals for help to find son s killer - Yahoo7
